intro: Semeionotis floribunda, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and somewhat woody. Semeionotis floribunda is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for.
